rules: Rule1: If drug X is in clinical trial, then drug X has completed phase 2.
Rule2: Under the condition that drug X is in clinical trial, it is not the case that drug X has completed phase 1.
Rule3: Drug X is in clinical trial, or if drug X is safety approved, then it does not have high efficacy.
Rule4: Drug X having completed phase 2 implies that drug X has completed phase 1.
Rule5: If drug X has regulatory approval, then in the case that it is not true that drug X is approved or effective, drug X does not have market withdrawal.
Rule6: Either drug X has patent granted or drug X has regulatory approval.
Rule7: Drug X has commercial launch or drug X does not have patent granted.
Rule8: Whenever drug X is tested, it results in drug X being approved.
Rule9: Drug X is tested, or drug X is researched.
Rule10: Provided that drug X is researched, it follows that drug X is developed.
Rule11: Either drug X is manufactured or drug X is effective.
Rule12: If drug X is prescribed, then either drug X is distributed or drug X is not manufactured.
Rule13: Drug X is administered, or drug X is prescribed.
Rule14: In the event that it is not true that drug X is approved or effective, drug X has market withdrawal.
Rule15: Whenever it is not true that if drug X is developed then it is effective, drug X is an alternative.
Rule16: Provided that it does not hold that if drug X is developed then it is effective, drug X is not an alternative.
Rule17: If it is false that when drug X is not effective then it has side effects, drug X has high efficacy.
Rule18: Under the condition that it is not the case that drug X not being effective implies it has side effects, drug X is safety approved.
facts: Fact1: It is not the case that drug X is approved.
Fact2: Drug X does not have side effects.
Fact3: Drug X does not have commercial launch.
Fact4: Drug X is not distributed.
Fact5: Drug X is not administered.
